block.p: Ann Lisa Schiffers, a daughter of Anita Schiffers of Mission Viejo, Calif., and Edmond Schiffers of Jacksonville, Fla., was married yesterday to Adam John Anuszkiewicz, the son of Sarah and Richard Anuszkiewicz of Englewood, N.J. Canon Bernard Dooly performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Cathedral in Jacksonville.

The bride, 33, who is keeping her name, is an architectural-lighting designer at Ann Kale Associates, a New York company that designs interior and exterior lighting installations for buildings. She is also an instructor of architectural lighting design at the New York School of Interior Design, the Parsons School of Design and the School of Visual Arts, all in New York. She graduated from the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and received a master's degree in architectural lighting design from Parsons.

Ann Lisa Schiffers, a daughter of Anita Schiffers of Mission Viejo, Calif., and Edmond Schiffers of Jacksonville, Fla., was married yesterday to Adam John Anuszkiewicz, the son of Sarah and Richard Anuszkiewicz of Englewood, N.J. Canon Bernard Dooly performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Cathedral in Jacksonville.

The bride, 33, who is keeping her name, is an architectural-lighting designer at Ann Kale Associates, a New York company that designs interior and exterior lighting installations for buildings. She is also an instructor of architectural lighting design at the New York School of Interior Design, the Parsons School of Design and the School of Visual Arts, all in New York. She graduated from the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and received a master's degree in architectural lighting design from Parsons.

The bride's father owns the Schiffers Groups, which are engaged in economics and real estate consulting in Jacksonville. Her stepmother, Margaret Shuman Espy Schiffers, owns Schiffers Associates, a consulting firm in Jacksonville that specializes in compensation and organizational analysis.

The bridegroom, 37, is a senior design associate at Robert A. M. Stern Architects in New York. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and received a master's degree in architecture from Yale University. His father is the Op Art painter and the bridegroom's mother is her husband's archivist.
